head.title: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Toms River: Suspect In 12-Year-Old Homicide

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Toms River: Suspect In 12-Year-Old Homicide

body.head.byline: By Steve Strunsky (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: Toms River, NJ, officials say that twelve years after landlady Matilda Hammock was found stabbed to death in rooming house she owned in Lakewood, former tenant Carl Harris is charged with killing her on basis of DNA evidence found at scene (S)

block.p: Twelve years after a landlady was found stabbed to death in the rooming house she owned in Lakewood, the authorities have charged a former tenant with killing her. DNA evidence found at the scene where the landlady, Matilda Hammock, 67, died, was reviewed by Ocean County's cold-case task force, said Gregory L. Sakowicz, the executive assistant county prosecutor. The former tenant, Carl Harris, 56, was arrested in Virginia Beach, Va., on a murder warrant on Oct. 19 and extradited to New Jersey on Friday. He is being held in the county jail in $250,000 bail.

Twelve years after a landlady was found stabbed to death in the rooming house she owned in Lakewood, the authorities have charged a former tenant with killing her. DNA evidence found at the scene where the landlady, Matilda Hammock, 67, died, was reviewed by Ocean County's cold-case task force, said Gregory L. Sakowicz, the executive assistant county prosecutor. The former tenant, Carl Harris, 56, was arrested in Virginia Beach, Va., on a murder warrant on Oct. 19 and extradited to New Jersey on Friday. He is being held in the county jail in $250,000 bail.
